thread.title: Hollywood And More React To The Shocking Death Of Bill Paxton At 61
thread.title_full: Hollywood And More React To The Shocking Death Of Bill Paxton At 61

author: Andrew Roberts
title: Hollywood And More React To The Shocking Death Of Bill Paxton At 61
text:
HBO
The loss of Bill Paxton would be a time of reflection at any point, but it stings a little more given the sudden nature of his passing. The Aliens star died due to complications from surgery on Sunday at the age of 61 and it shocked many across the internet. Paxton was not only a staple of classic films like Twister , Aliens , and Weird Science — with many using the hashtag #RIPChet to remember him and quoting his many lines as Hudson — but he was also an actor that could fill a multitude of varying roles with quality and strength. He could play an astronaut in Apollo 13 and then turn around to play a skeevy used car salesman in True Lies , with both turning out to be memorable performances. 
My favourite #BillPaxton performance was in TRUE LIES. A wannabe spy who was really just a wimp trying his best to get laid. pic.twitter.com/P0hWMwIEXL 
— Martin White (@Film_Bookworm) February 26, 2017 

To see his impact, look no further than the people he worked with and was admired by in Hollywood. There’s no shortage of praise from folks like Jamie Lee Curtis, Aaron Paul, and Rob Lowe:
N . Bill Paxton is gone. Such a funny, talented, loving human. Louise & the children & family my ❤& support 2 u. #truelies pic.twitter.com/d4zleWdOrR 
— Jamie Lee Curtis (@jamieleecurtis) February 26, 2017 
Bill Paxton is 1of my favorite actors.I was able 2tell him so when we met yrs ago.Paxton was wonderful in everything he did. He inspired us. pic.twitter.com/hAXR9unvb6 
— Vincent D'Onofrio (@vincentdonofrio) February 26, 2017 
Devastated by the sudden loss of my close friend and one of the finest actors in the business, Bill Paxton. Renaissance man, raconteur and
— Rob Lowe (@RobLowe) February 26, 2017 
uniquely American national treasure. His filmography speaks for itself. His friendship was a blessing. My love to Bunny, James and Lydia.
— Rob Lowe (@RobLowe) February 26, 2017 
In his memory, on this Oscar Sunday, watch "One False Move" or "A Simple Plan" to see this lovely leading man, at his finest.
— Rob Lowe (@RobLowe) February 26, 2017 


Bill Paxton was hands down one of the greatest guys that I have ever met. I feel lucky to have called him my friend. Bill, I love you. RIP.
— Aaron Paul (@aaronpaul_8) February 26, 2017 
What a lovely, warm and kind human. So sad to hear of Bill Paxton's passing.
— Elijah Wood (@elijahwood) February 26, 2017 
Bill Paxton. A very talented man. As skilled with comedy as he was with drama. Carpe Diem. #rip pic.twitter.com/2ULKQJUzI4 
— Zach Braff (@zachbraff) February 26, 2017 
Condolences to the family of Bill Paxton. I just heard the news. 
— William Shatner (@WilliamShatner) February 26, 2017 
Very sad to hear about Bill Paxton. His talent, enthusiasm and energy were unique. Our thoughts are with his family pic.twitter.com/W4IVuILHxv 
— Cary Elwes (@Cary_Elwes) February 26, 2017 
Sad news about Bill Paxton – too young. Always humanity, decency and touches of humor shining through his work. RIP.
— Jeffrey Wright (@jfreewright) February 26, 2017 


Sad to hear about the passing of Bill Paxton. With NIGHTCRAWLER and EDGE OF TOMORROW, he's been doing some great character acting. #RIP 
— Doug Benson (@DougBenson) February 26, 2017 
RIP Bill Paxton. So very good every time. In addition to his iconic roles, he was amazing in Near Dark, A Simple Plan & Edge of Tomorrow.
— Kumail Nanjiani (@kumailn) February 26, 2017 
Bill Paxton was notoriously one of the nicest people in the industry. He also gave us some of the all-time most iconic movie moments.
— Jordan Peele (@JordanPeele) February 26, 2017 
Bill Paxton was the fuckin man. So glad I was drunk enough to tell him exactly that one time at comic con. Legend.
— Anders Holm (@ders808) February 26, 2017 
I am stunned & saddened at the passing of Bill Paxton. I just worked with him recently. A warm and beautiful soul and a talented actor. RIP
— Lou Diamond Phillips (@LouDPhillips) February 26, 2017 
How sad. 61 is definitely too young to die. But Bill Paxton will always be Chet to me https://t.co/k8utwA741J pic.twitter.com/qiVNdIRA1K 
— Hadley Freeman (@HadleyFreeman) February 26, 2017 
My reaction when hearing Bill Paxton is dead pic.twitter.com/61NI7XPPKU 
— Megen (@MegenKay) February 26, 2017 


Others are also choosing their own ways to honor Paxton and the entertainment he provided over the years. 
We'll miss ya, Bill Paxton. https://t.co/nExBEptVAV pic.twitter.com/mmY6RBTfks 
— U.S. Tornadoes (@USTornadoes) February 26, 2017 
I know he did a lot more, but when I think of Bill Paxton I will always think of Weird Science. RIP Chet. #didyouspitinthis ? pic.twitter.com/9muY3dFLNQ 
— ProFootballTalk (@ProFootballTalk) February 26, 2017 
So sad to hear the news of Bill Paxton. On our show only 3 weeks ago. Real sense of fun and a favourite guest https://t.co/IgofF94ROW 
— Ben Winston (@benwinston) February 26, 2017 
To hear that Bill Paxton, one of our favorite screen presences, passed away today at 61, is very sad. He will be missed. pic.twitter.com/nKyrdX7XTO 
— One Perfect Shot (@OnePerfectShot) February 26, 2017 
Often when actor passes, there's one movie you feel need to revisit. With Bill Paxton, list so long that I don't even know where to begin.
— John Squires (@FreddyInSpace) February 26, 2017 

And really, this is the perfect way to sum up the loss of Bill Paxton. Loss always sucks, but it’s worse when it’s so shocking and takes a guy that’s so entertaining. 
GODDAMN. POUR ONE OUT FOR AN ALLTIME GREAT THE ONE AND ONLY WILD BILL PAXTON
— ZODIAC MOTHERFUCKER (@ZODIAC_MF) February 26, 2017
